lua::LuaState Class Reference
[Scripting support library (Lua C++ wrapper)]

#include <LuaState.h>

Inheritance diagram for lua::LuaState:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

State of Lua script running environment.

Member Function Documentation

void lua::LuaState::call (  int  nargs,
int  nresults
) 
 

Calls Lua function.

Functions defined in Lua and C functions registered in Lua can be called from the host program. This is done using the following protocol: First, the function to be called is pushed onto the stack; then, the arguments to the function are pushed in direct order, that is, the first argument is pushed first.

Parameters:
nargs Number of arguments that you pushed onto the stack.
nresults Number of results returned are adjusted to this number.
Exceptions:
LuaException 

void lua::LuaState::checkType (  int  index,
Type  type
) 
 

Checks type at specified stack index.

Exceptions:

Pushes on the stack the environment table of the function at index index in the stack.

void lua::LuaState::getTable (  int  index  ) 
 

Pops a key from the stack and returns (on the stack) the contents of the table at that key.

The table is left where it was in the stack.

Exceptions:
LuaException 

LuaTable& lua::LuaState::globals (   ) 
 

Returns table of Lua state globals.

void lua::LuaState::incorrectType (  int  index  ) 
 

Called after dynamic cast fails to specified type when dispatching calls.

Used by implementation.

Parameters:
index Lua stack index where the incorrect type was found.
Exceptions:
LuaException Always.

void lua::LuaState::insert (  int  index  ) 
 

Moves the top element into the given position, shifting up the elements above that position to open space.

void lua::LuaState::newTable (   ) 
 

Creates a new, empty table and pushes it onto the stack.

Exceptions:
LuaException 

bool lua::LuaState::next (  int  index  ) 
 

The function pops a key from the stack, and pushes a key-value pair from the table (the "next" pair after the given key).

If there are no more elements, then next returns false and pushes nothing. Use a nil key to signal the start of a traversal.

Exceptions:
LuaException 

void lua::LuaState::pop (  int  n = 1  ) 
 

Pops n values from the stack.

Usually do not use this method (unless while iterating a table), but LuaStackRestore instead.

void lua::LuaState::push (  int  index  ) 
 

Pushes onto the stack a copy of the element at the given index.

template<class T>
void lua::LuaState::pushMethodClosure (  T *  obj,
int(T::*  func)(LuaState *)
) 
 

Pushes method closure onto the Lua stack.

Method has fixed function calling convention, returns int and accepts one argument, LuaState*. Arguments passed from the script to the function are passed on top of Lua stack, and return value(s) are returned on top of Lua stack. Function should return number of return values in Lua stack.

void lua::LuaState::rawGet (  int  index  ) 
 

Pops a key from the stack and returns (on the stack) the contents of the table at that key.

The table is left where it was in the stack. Ignores metamethods.

Exceptions:
LuaException 

void lua::LuaState::rawGetI (  int  index,
int  n
) 
 

Pushes the value of the n-th element of the table at stack position index.

Exceptions:
LuaException 

void lua::LuaState::rawSet (  int  index  ) 
 

Pops from the stack both the key and the value.

Key must be pushed first, and then value. The table is left where it was in the stack. Ignores metamethods.

Exceptions:
LuaException 

void lua::LuaState::rawSetI (  int  index,
int  n
) 
 

Sets the value of the n-th element of the table at stack position index to the value at the top of the stack, removing this value from the stack.

Exceptions:
LuaException 

void lua::LuaState::replace (  int  index  ) 
 

Moves the top element into the given position, without shifting any element therefore replacing the value at the given position.

void lua::LuaState::setFEnv (  int  index  ) 
 

Pops a table from the stack and sets it as the new environment for the function at index index in the stack.

Exceptions:
LuaException 

void lua::LuaState::setTable (  int  index  ) 
 

Pops from the stack both the key and the value.

Key must be pushed first, and then value. The table is left where it was in the stack.

Exceptions:
LuaException 

void lua::LuaState::setTop (  int  index  ) 
 

Sets top of stack.

Accepts any acceptable index, or 0, and sets the stack top to that index. If the new top is larger than the old one, then the new elements are filled with nil. If index is 0, then all stack elements are removed.

bool lua::LuaState::toBoolean (  int  index  ) 
 

Returns boolean at specified stack position.

Exceptions:
